creator: glen@delfi.ee
text:
# httpd -f /etc/httpd/apache.conf -k stop 
httpd: Syntax error on line 69 of /etc/httpd/apache.conf: Could not open 
configuration file /etc/httpd/conf.d/nagios.conf: No such file or directory 
 
and apache stays running. it's quite unexpected for me that stop needs working 
config. perhaps i want to stop it because i have broken config? 
 
and /etc/httpd/conf.d/nagios.conf is a symlink to inexistent file.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
The pidfile location (as a notable example) is specified in the configuration so
it needs to be read before shutting the server down; this behaviour is by design.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
The bug isn't really invalid.  More a WONTFIX, at least until and unless

bearing in mind, though.  I'd mark it LATER if that had any meaning.
